content.title: Rich Text Type
content.content:
The `rich-text` type is the most convenient way to represent the **main content** of documents.
It allows the input of **formatted and styled textual data**. Internally, Sapphire stores this data as **Markdown**.

The `rich-text` type is recommended for any **long chunks of text**, even if the text is not heavily formatted or styled.
For relatively short strings — such as titles, names, or short sentences — the `text` type should be used instead.

Defining a `rich-text` field in your content schema is straightforward.
Simply declare it like this:

```yaml
name: blog
type: collection
fields:
  - name: content
    type: rich-text
    required: true
```
